comments:
I'm getting the following in the debugger.  I will try to step over a method 
and get (after a relatively short time) 

Step over failed
Reason: Exception occurred attempting to step over the frame
Details: org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException occurred stepping in thread.

Is this parameterizable?  I'm not sure why I should be getting this in this 
case.  I've included the stack trace.

Regards

Eric Kaplan

The stack trace provided, and the error message you receive in the dialog 
appear to be different problems. The stack trace shows a "thread not suspended" 
condition, while the error dialog indicates a timeout communicating with the 
target VM. This can be controlled on the "Java -> Debug" preference page: 
the "Debugger timeout".

* What VM are you debugging with?
* Can you reproduce the problem reliably?
* Does increasing the timeout value change the behavior?

This is sun jdk1.4.1_02.  However, it may not be a bug so much as I was unaware 
of the ability to set a timeout.  I tried once again to reproduce and it did 
not happen.  For now, I will change the resolution to INVALID.
